text: Config file contains a set of values that determine how file(s) are processed. Creating a config file is not necessary. Splix will apply a recommended configuration automatically, but sometimes this may cause problems, or you might want to tune the output.
export_mode determines if Splix should create a new output directory for encoded file(s). The default value is 0, which indicates that a new directory aex_export_YY_MM_DD will be created.

cmd: export_dir allows the user to set a custom output directory. If the directory does not exist, Splix will create a new directory in the specified path.
backup_mode defines if original file(s) should be saved. Default value is 1, which indicates that a new directory aex_backup_YY_MM_DD will be created.
backup_dir will allow the user to set a custom backup directory. Invalid directory values will be ignored. If backup mode is set to false, this will be ignored as well.
auto_match_top determines if Splix should automatically detect overlapping lines. Overlapping lines will be set to the top of the screen. It is recommended to leave this setting to true.
remove_long_line will determine if lines containing too many characters should be removed. The default value is 0 which means that long lines are allowed.
